docs.text: " goodbye , lover " sat on the shelf for almost a year since its lukewarm reception at the cannes film festival last may , and one look will tell you why .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's a mess .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and that's * way * before ellen degeneres shows up .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film is one of those torrid double-indemnity crime stories that , in this case , required the services of three screenwriters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i suspect that one wrote a sexy thriller , one wrote a murder mystery , and one wrote a comedy , then director roland joff ? tried to piece it all together in the editing room while scratching his head in bewilderment .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i didn't laugh at ellen degeneres much ( i think i was supposed to ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: degeneres is horrible and her character is even worse , a tough-talking vulgar cop with a bad wardrobe and bad hair .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: either degeneres is wearing a wig--as most of the actors appear to be--or she doesn't yet have enough clout to secure a hairstylist .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: every single word out of her mouth is supposed to be racy and hip , but her incessant wisecracking is poorly-written and merely stupid .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: her reaction to the brutal killing of a jogger is " at least she died healthy . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and that's one of her wittier asides .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: degeneres' sgt .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: rita pompano is called in to investigate the allegedly accidental death of . . . wait .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to give away too much of the plot would all but ruin a film that has very little going for it outside of its numbing plot twists and multiple triple-crosses .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's best described this way :
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sultry sexpot/real estate agent sandra dunmore ( patricia arquette ) is married to jake , a " creative yet unfocused " ( and alcoholic ) advertising rep , played by dermot mulroney .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sandra likes to act out her deep-seated sexual fantasies and jake's brother ben ( the suave-as-ever don johnson ) likes to help .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ben is also coming on to his petite , mousy co-worker peggy blaine ( mary-louise parker ) and someone , somewhere , is planning to cash in on that huge life insurance policy of his .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film is ripe with cheating lovers cheating on each other and back again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although there are some genuine surprises , the plot twists get too contrived too quickly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: probably around the time degeneres' gumcracking gumshoe appears .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at least the former " ellen " star is going for something a little different .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: arquette turns in yet another of her stiletto-heeled , platinum blonde bombshell roles ( see : " lost highway , " " true romance " ) while quoting embarrassing lines like " i'm not wearing any underwear . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i hope she got paid a lot of money to do this .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here's an example of some of the film's flat-out stupidity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sandra purchases a used car and disguises herself in a red wig prior to stalking two of the film's duplicitous lovers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she drives the motorbiking couple off a cliff while blaring her favorite " the sound of music " on her car stereo , intent on identifying herself to her hapless victims .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so what was the point of the wig and the car ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " the sound of music " stuff might be a reference to " the wizard of oz " allusions in david lynch's " wild at heart , " but if so joff ? must have forgotten that " wild at heart " was a despicable movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's hard to believe that " goodbye , lover " was directed by the same person who made " the killing fields " and " the mission . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's not , however , hard to see why it sat on the shelf for so long .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it should have stayed there .
docs.label: negative
